edu.umass.cs.protocoltask

Class ThresholdProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.protocoltask.ThresholdProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeIDType -
    EventType -
    KeyType - This abstract class is concretized for Long keys, int node IDs, and ProtocolPackets. Its purpose is to receive responses from a threshold number of nodes in the specified set. To enable this, instantiators of this abstract class must implement (1) a "boolean handleEvent(event)" method that says whether or not the response was valid, which helps ThresholdProtocolTask automatically stop retrying with nodes that have already responded; (2) a handleThresholdEvent(.) method that returns a protocol task to be executed when the threshold is reached (returning null automatically cancels the task as it is considered complete).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>, SchedulableProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>, Keyable<KeyType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MajorityFetchProtocolTask, WaitAckDropEpoch, WaitAckStartEpoch, WaitAckStopEpoch, WaitEpochFinalState

    public abstract class ThresholdProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SchedulableProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>
    Author:
    V. Arun

      This method automatically keeps track of senders from which we have already received valid responses in order to keep track of whether the threshold has been reached, and if so, it invokes handleThresholdEvent

      • handleThresholdEvent

        public GenericMessagingTask<NodeIDType,?>[] handleThresholdEvent(ProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>[] ptasks)
        Default action is to cancel the protocol task when the threshold is reached.
        Parameters:
        ptasks -
        Returns:
        Returns messaging tasks to be performed when the threshold is reached. Additional protocol task actions may also be spawned via ptasks[0].

      • handleEvent

        public final GenericMessagingTask<NodeIDType,?>[] handleEvent(ProtocolEvent<EventType,KeyType> event,
                                                              ProtocolTask<NodeIDType,EventType,KeyType>[] ptasks)
        This method automatically keeps track of senders from which we have already received valid responses in order to keep track of whether the threshold has been reached, and if so, it invokes handleThresholdEvent
